Stayed with a pet
review_text: Eric’s instructions for location and entry were precise and clear. If visiting Univ. of Oregon, you would be challenged to find a better location. The functional use of the space was unbelievable - shelving to place personal items, plenty of outlets for charging, private yard for the dogs, ground floor with easy access to parked car for unloading and loading, LOTS of towels, toilet paper, soap selection, tea/coffee choices, heated floors, dog bowl and pup towels and quiet! The bed and bedding were high quality and comfortable - everything about the studio apartment is new - were we one of his first customers or does he just pay that much attention to detail? I’d love to come back!

The unit is very close to a great coffee and pastry shop, as well as Hendricks Park and Onsen (some of our favorite spots in town). I highly recommend!

name: Joseph
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
December 2022
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Spent a night here on our road trip to Washington. We arrived fairly late, under poor weather conditions (freezing rain). Thanks to the helpful instructions and communication from Eric and his co-hosts, it was extremely easy to find the studio and unload.
The studio had some nice touches to it. Particularly, we found that the heated flooring worked much better than anticipated, given how cold it was outside. There were also some clever additions, such as cards and games to keep guests occupied. You will also find very reliable Internet and media streaming. These are some of the things you typically won’t find in a standard hotel.
The biggest perk for us, was how well-priced the listing was, given that we were provided amenities generally found outside this price range. We were all comfortable throughout our short stay, and our dog enjoyed every last bit of the private back patio/yard. This will definitely be in our list for any future visits through Eugene.
Thank you!

Wow, what a place!
Stayed at this lovely studio for just a couple nights with my dog and had a lovely stay.
I greatly appreciated that my dog and I were able to have a small yard to ourselves, what an amazing perk!
The coffee pods, extra blanket for the dog, soft blankets, and numerous other small touches really made me feel comfortable staying here.
It also needs to be worth mentioning how wonderful this location is! You can walk almost anywhere from the campus, to grocery store, to some of the most amazing restaurants and bakeries in Eugene!
I will for sure be in the area again and hope to stay at this place in the future.

review_text: Great location and place has tons of charm! Yard was perfect for our greyhounds and the neighborhood was great for walking. Runners can get to the trail along the river easily. Lots of built-in storage allows for what could be “cozy” to feel spacious because you can put your things away and keep the floors clear. We did fine with 2 Greyhounds and 2 adults. Bathroom had a nice large shower with skylight. We didn’t stay long enough to enjoy the deck, but it was a nice space too. Appreciated the parking spot off the road. Easy access to the home and quick/easy communication with the host.

review_text: Would not have been able to stay another night. The small studio space is tastefully done and clean, with a fully fenced in backyard area that was great for our small dog. Host communication was great and we appreciated the option to check in early. But the space is so small that it was hard to even open up our airplane carryon size luggage, and the dorm room fridge was tiny. No kitchenette (sink, hot plate, microwave) but I knew that going into it. Unfortunately, the window unit AC was not able to keep the space cool overnight and when I opened the windows and backdoor to let the cool night air in at 3 am, constant train, car, truck, and people noises made it impossible to sleep so I had to shut everything again. The location is 2 doors down from several restaurants that stayed busy until late, even on a Monday night. Since we didn’t have any need for proximity to the university or partying late, if I had it to do over, I would’ve stayed outside of town in a bigger place for less $. But probably a good location for a solo traveler who needs a short term stay, has no need to cook, and is a heavy sleeper.

Rating, 4 stars

April 2024
,

Stayed one night
review_text:
Geoff is a good and proactive host. I'm sensitive to perfumes and scents, especially those that seem to last forever and sometimes use nanoparticles. But Geoff's description was accurate: his cleaners use isopropyl mixed with dishwasher soap and nothing else, and scents were not a problem.
The place is cozy, with good split-duct heating, a marvelous enclosed shower, and a bathroom fan with select-a-time switches, so you don't leave it running inadvertently. (You need a bathroom fan in Eugene, with its high humidity, to clear out mist when you shower.) The microwave is a little low and hard to see in, but it works well.
The location is excellent, in a quiet, upscale residential neighborhood about seven blocks from the University. It's a long walk or short drive to Beppe & Gianni, a classic-style Italian restaurant in a converted home, which makes its own pasta.
The studio lacked Kleenex, bag racks and a shoe rack, but this is minor stuff. We would stay there again.

review_text: 10/10. This is an absolutely stellar Airbnb. We were in Eugene for a week for the Junior Olympics and couldn’t have asked for a better place to stay. The location was fantastic, located in a cute, cozy, and quiet neighborhood easy walking distance to Hayward and lots of dining options on 19th. The studio is immaculate, with a full kitchen which was so nice for us to have with her races spread out throughout the week. Geoff had great recommendations with his listing and was helpful with a few other questions I had. Always a quick reply and super friendly! A+ experience!!

We ate and excellent brunch at Studio One- within walking distance- also grabbed treats to go from Sweet Life. What a fun location! We will he staying here again next time we head to Eugene!

Outstanding!!!
This sweet studio exceeded our expectations. It was very clean, neat, and tidy and has many great amenities. The sheets (so soft) and towels were fluffy white and high quality. The King bed was very comfortable. The kitchen was fully stocked with everything we would need to prepare a nice meal if we had not opted to eat most our meals out. The home is located within walking distance to fun restaurants. We had the best pizza at McMenamins. We enjoyed the Amazon trail. We rented Electric Bikes at Eugene Electric Bikes. The Willamette river trail was glorious. The small outdoor space was a great spot for our morning coffee, evening wine and appetizers. Thank you for sharing your sweet studio.
Diane & Mark Poulsbo, Wa

The check-in and check-out process were the easiest I’ve experienced at any Airbnb I’ve stayed at before. The host was very communicative and responsive and provided some great recommendations for stuff close by. I would absolutely love to stay here again!

The back yard is a lovely oasis where the provided rockers made a wonderful place to drink our (provided) morning coffee. Husband is a little unsteady and uses a cane, so the street parking, paved driveway and easy access through carport made it super easy for him as well as getting our rollerbags in. Will definitely stay again when we visit.

Cute tiny space perfect for just me. Comfy bed, clean and nice and quiet. It wa also nice and warm when I got in there later in the evening my first night.
The water pressure is pretty weak and the water heater must not be high…my shower was disappointing and I had to make it quick. I didn’t even bother the second day. And there is no kitchen. They have a setup for coffee with a kettle and French press (makes a wonderful cup) and cute coffee mugs. But no way to clean it between uses. Maybe a Keurig or Nespresso machine would suit the space better.
Really cute sitting area at a beautiful wooden counter that looks out into their nicely cared for backyard.

I’ve stayed at Holly’s twice, and wholeheartedly recommend it if you’re looking for a small little oasis.
As a single woman traveling alone, it feels very safe and just the right size.
The bathtub is deep and luxurious and the bed is so comfortable! Plan to eat at least one meal sitting at the little bar looking out on the backyard. (It’s especially nice after a hard day!)
Holly is a great hostess and she is assisted by the tail-wagging, wiggling-body greetings of Sadie.

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Cleanliness is one of the biggest factors in whether an Airbnb is comfortable and relaxing for me and my daughter. I was impressed with the lack of dust, even on the decor, but mostly the lack of hair on floors and sinks, etc. from previous guests. There was no mildew or dirty grout in the shower/tub. I did not cringe in my bare feet. Kudos to McKenzy and Ian's cleaner! I imagine that there is a lot of varying opinions on what makes a bed comfortable; but for me, I do not enjoy sinking into a hole on overly soft/memory foam types of mattresses (that tends to hurt my back). The mattresses here were not like that - they were not too firm, but not squishy. The linens were soft and were freshly cleaned. A bonus was that either they have a water softener or the water in Eugene is just not as hard as where I'm from. There was not calcium/residue on any of the dishes or silverware. And I am grateful for the responsiveness and care from McKenzy, as well - prior, during, and after our stay.

The washer and dryer is a huge plus (for... you know, life with kids...), the games were plentiful, the kids toys were a great hit, and the kitchen was well-stocked with essentials... and when we asked for something (kitchen tongs), they were provided within an hour. That level of attention is unheard of! This house, these hosts (including co-hosts), and this location will be our #1 choice for all future Eugene trips, and should be yours too. I cannot provide a higher recommendation... and I should know, as I am a super-host myself!

review_text:
Beautiful home and responsive hosts. Easy drive to town, but in a lovely quiet wooded area. Great trail nearby for getting kids out on nature walks and a backyard that is a dream (though we definitely didn’t let our kids run around without us because of the small “bridges” in the back that they decided were pirate planks). The inside was spacious and fit our family of four very well with room to spare. Really lovely style and modern furnishings and appliances and we appreciated the attention to detail like kid friendly plates and cutlery. The 4 year old enjoyed the Disney movies included :) It was immaculately clean and kept very cool even on an 80 degree weekend. Loved how organized everything was and easy to find what we needed.
Our only tip for future guests is that if you have young children who nap during daytime still, there are no blinds, just pretty thin curtains but the area is pretty shaded.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: If you have to get stuck somewhere during a rare Eugene "icepocalypse", try to get stuck at Monica's. It is extremely clean, cozy, and the pump heater kept us warm while we hung out, watched football, read books, and didn't do much...everything (and I mean EVERYTHING) was closed or we would have been out and about. It's a great location and nice and quiet. It was dangerous to even walk outside because the ground was so slippery, we did go out to eat at the one place that was open, and saw people falling down and cars sliding and fishtailing, scary stuff. The place has everything you need and Monica's communication was excellent. We have family in Eugene so we visit often. If availability allows, we'll definitely come back here. Thank you Monica!!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Lucky 13 is a beautiful, well-thought-out apartment. Though the street is busy, and traffic is fast (I parked around the corner rather than in front) the locked gate and private entrance made this apartment feel safe and secluded. So much thought has gone into this space and it really has everything. When I asked to add a night onto my reservation Monica took care of it and only charged one cleaning fee for my whole stay. I will definitely book again. My advice for people who don't wash their hair every day is to bring a shower cap, as the rain/waterfall style showerhead makes it difficult to avoid wetting hair, and if you are fragrance sensitive, ask ahead to have the oil diffuser removed. This was a great find. I do feel lucky to have been a guest!

name: Mark
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
June 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The Lucky 13 Studio in central Eugene is wonderful in every respect. It is well located, obviously quite new (with amenities like dimmers or most lights, new very effective heat pump/air conditioner), a small but complete kitchen, a very comfortable queen sized bed, and a nice bathroom, with washer and dryer. There is even a small patio seating area outside to enjoy your coffee, or a glass of wine. The studio is small, and could not accommodate more than 2 people sleeping, but there is a love seat and a couple of stools at the kitchen bar, so having a friend or two stop by for a coffee or a drink would be possible, albeit cozy. I could go on about this lovely place, but will add just one more comment which is the vaulted ceilings give a great feeling of spaciousness, despite the fairly small footprint. The ceiling also has a pair of large skylights so the whole place is bathed in terrific natural light during the day. Be aware though, you’ll have a hard time sleeping in or taking a nap if you require darkness for sleeping. I don’t have that problem and slept in with no problem, and it was actually very nice to wake up to the daylight. The host, Monica, was very quick and responsive to a couple of questions I had.

My friend and I were commenting on how the sheets smelled amazing!
Host was readily available.
Sun porch was the main reason I booked the place and I was not disappointed:) it was beautiful and perfect for the hot weather.
We did stay over during a 90+ degree weekend, and the bedroom got a bit stuffy, but they had a portable fan that helped, and on the second night I kept the bedroom door open to let the AC from the living room flow through. It helped alot.
Would stay again!

review_text: I come to Eugene often to work at the U of O library and this is my favorite airbnb in Eugene. It takes a lot to make me come back to a place and this one has it all. Lisa is a great host who kindly let us in a little early when my husband had a zoom appointment and needed to use the Internet. I love the location on an alley back up against the trees and the hills. It has felt completely private whenever we stayed. Perhaps my favorite thing is how from all the windows you can see beautiful trees and the Oregon outdoors. Even though it was too cold and rainy to use the porch I love the porch and how it adds a layer of privacy and views to hanging out in the living room. I love looking out the door in the living room and hearing and watching the rain. Lisa keeps everything in top notch shape and you will have everything you need. Comfy beds, nice tub, good temp control, excellent kitchen, great washer dryer, and a gorgeous oak tree on the front deck. Nicely walkable to U of O--I forgot, I love how easy it is to get around on foot from here! A winner!

Bathroom clean, well stocked. Overall home well designed, comfortable - all seating was great and not just hanging on before they should be replaced. TV and AC easy to use. Wonderful!

name: Shelley
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2021
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text: This is my favorite AirbNb I've stayed in while traveling back and forth from San Diego to Eugene the last few years. It is a lovely place that is thoughtfully organized and beautifully maintained. Lisa was a great communicator who even offered to let us check in early when the place was clean before the 4 PM check in time. Arrival was smooth and the keypad system worked easily. I was so happy when I saw the place for the first time--it is so beautiful. I love how it is situated, with complete privacy by the alley and very quiet, with beautiful trees and greenery out every window. The porch is stunning and nicely decorated. I loved sitting in the living room on the couch and writing while I watched the birds and the rain out the windows. There is also a nice little door in there you can open to let in fresh air. The kitchen is one of the best AirBnB kitchens ever in terms of being well-stocked and well-organized with great appliances and everything was super clean. We slept really well on the excellent bed and also enjoyed taking baths in the perfectly clean tub. Really, it was a dreamy stay in a beautiful place and is good for creative people who want to work on projects as well as people who want to go to sports events nearby. I loved walking to campus every day for the work I was doing at U of Oregon. A really nice walk that I look forward to taking again, when I hopefully come back in March. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Eugene if this is available! Thank you Lisa!

Kitchen is ready to use, with new appliances and plenty of pots and pans. I would recommend Orchard's place if you would like a comfortable and well-appointed home near the university, about 1/2 mile from the Interstate (for easy access).

review_text:
It was me and my friend’s first time in Oregon and we wanted to stay somewhere walkable, peaceful, and pretty. This listing was the perfect size and location we were envisioning so we happily went with this one. We felt like two fairies in a cute cottage garden! Tucked cozily away in her backyard, we had enough privacy and we had all the amenities we needed. The bed was sooooo comfy! I usually have trouble sleeping when I’m not in my own bed and/or some place different, but I had no problem falling asleep which was greatly noted by me.
Rebecca was responsive and answered any questions we had. My friend and I liked how she was the right amount of attentive. I would love to stay here again the next time I visit Eugene!

review_text: We loved our stay! The cottage is in the backyard of what I consider to be a pretty quintessential Eugene house, and in a great part of town (we definitely took advantage of our proximity to Prince Puckler's!). It was also nice that the cottage was right next to a fence door that led into an alley, which meant that we didn't have to walk through the hosts' yard to come and go. The space itself was exactly what we wanted. I would definitely stay here again!

Because our stay was for the Oregon Country Fair, an event that Rebecca, the host, is involved in, and where she stayed the entire time, we didn’t have the pleasure of meeting her, but her husband, Peter, and their adorable dogs, Dobby and Fang were there to greet us and get us situated. There is a sign on the door cautioning one to “watch your step”, but I was so preoccupied looking into the room I stumbled off the step that takes you downward into the room, so do watch that step. The location was extremely convenient for us as it was within walking distance of several excellent eateries, markets, and a Starbucks, but we highly recommend Studio One Cafe for breakfast two short blocks away. This is a very nice place to stay.

review_text:
The cottage was exactly what I was looking for my trip down memory lane. It was close enough to UO campus and some great restaurants that I walked nearly the entire time I was there. The property is also well-maintained with lots of garden plants. There was a large tree and a grape pergola next to the cottage that shielded it from the sun, so it always felt comfortable in there, even when the outside temperature was warm. The cottage seemed well insulated too with great windows. I didn't feel chilly in the mornings at all, even when I slept with the windows open. The concrete flooring also helped moderate the inside temperature. The place is very private, so I was able to relax and unwind more readily.
Rebecca was also very communicative and gave me all the information I needed for self-checkin. There is also a designated parking spot for guests. Her dogs are wonderful and friendly. I'd stay here again!

(I especially look forward to a summer time visit, because even in the middle of winter, I can tell she has an AMAZING garden!)

Stayed one night
review_text: I wish I could have stayed in Eugene longer after having such a cozy night in Rebecca's cottage. The space is clean and comfortable as advertised, just around the corner from some restaurants and a quick walk to UO. Rebecca was very quick to respond to messages and even let me stay parked in her driveway after check-out so that I didn't have to pay for street parking elsewhere. I will definitely stay here again if I come to Eugene.

name: Leslie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2019
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We wanted a quiet, private-entrance accommodation, which we got, but this was so much more. The Cozy Cottage lived up to its name from the pre-heated radiant-heat floors to all we could need to prepare our own meals in-house, including coffee, tea, and cooking spices. The linens were plentiful and high quality; the bright interior and furnishings, welcoming and bright. With all the thoughtful touches throughout, it was even better than home away from home. Rebecca is an excellent communicator, gave us great tips for the area including a thoughtful binder and local magazines. A wide variety of eateries within walking distance. A lovely, safe neighborhood. Uber service within 2-3 minutes with every use (we used them a lot). Highly recommend. We'll be back.
